programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
The police helicopter team pursues an armed robber trying to evade arrest, and new recruits put their detective skills to the test by apprehending suspected burglars. PC Russ Gay tries to calm down a group of unruly drunken youths and Zippy the sniffer dog makes an interesting discovery inside a stolen car
S03E14

programme.title: Angel and the Badman (1947)
programme.desc: A gunslinger determined to track down his father's killer is badly wounded and taken in by a Quaker family, whose daughter nurses him back to health. His attraction to the girl and growing respect for the family's peaceful way of life lead him to consider renouncing violence - but his desire for revenge proves hard to surrender. Western, starring John Wayne, Bruce Cabot and Gail Russell

programme.title: Arrowhead (1953)
programme.desc: A cavalry scout witnesses a series of raids by an Apache tribe that is supposedly in peace talks - but his superiors reject his story out of hand and dismiss him from duty. Continuing to spy on the tribe, he comes to suspect the chief's son is behind the attacks. Western, starring Charlton Heston, Jack Palance and Katy Jurado

programme.title: Trucking Hell

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc:

S02E12

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:

programme.title: Trucking Hell
programme.desc:
Just outside Newcastle, Kev is sent to rescue a wheelie bin delivery truck that has got stuck. With rain forecast, this job is turning into a nightmare

programme.title: Warship: Life at Sea
programme.desc:
HMS Northumberland hunts for a Russian submarine in the Arctic Circle after the vessel disappears from the ship's radar. While the search continues chef Sauhil is feeling the strain below deck as he helps cook dinner for the crew of 200, but the preparations are interrupted by a serious incident as poisonous fumes seep into the upper deck
S03E03

programme.title: The Kingdom (2007)
programme.desc: In the wake of the bombing of an American military facility in Saudi Arabia, an FBI agent is given five days to find the perpetrators. However, he encounters suspicion and obstruction from the local authorities, who do not take kindly to Westerners meddling in their affairs. The only person he can turn to is a Saudi police officer, who assists with tracking down an elusive terrorist cell. Thriller, with Jamie Foxx, Jennifer Garner and Chris Cooper

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:
Documentary showing how CCTV and other technological advances are helping to bring car thieves to justice. Suspected criminals in Chester are involved in a high-speed chase through the city centre, and there is footage that helped put an end to one of London's most prolific gangs. The programme also includes film of a getaway in which robbers tried to evade the law by driving at 180mph
S01E04

programme.title: Column South (1953)
programme.desc: A Cavalry officer who has been the lifelong friend of a Navajo chief works to ensure peace is maintained between their people. As the first conflicts of the Civil War begin, a group of Confederate agents plots to undermine the Union by tricking the two old friends into waging war on each other. Western, starring Audie Murphy and Dennis Weaver

programme.title: Bandolero! (1968)
programme.desc: An outlaw due to be hanged is rescued at the last minute by his brother, and together they go on the run with a hostage, hotly pursued by the local sheriff. programme.desc:

S03E07

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc:
Steve Graham fights torrid weather conditions as he tries to create a road train, while Yogi's truck breaks down on a cross-country journey
S02E13

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Damo is involved in a high-speed pursuit, but the driver manages to give him the slip, while interceptors' helicopter spots five runners from a crashed car. Dog handler Mo is called out to a mansion, Jacko tackles an angry mob after taking down a dodgy scooter driver, and Spike and Pete stop a speeding car driven by a fast talker
S14E04

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Rookie team member Rachael faces a baptism of fire on a night shift, from a face-off with a driver threatening her colleague Lee's family, to the pursuit of a high-speed Mercedes carrying with a pregnant passenger. Elsewhere, Liam plays a pitch-black game of hunt the knife in the aftermath of a terrifying armed robbery, dog handler Mo deals with a double fire before arresting a man who appears to be stealing from a phone box, and a motorist picks up the phone and calls the police to report interceptor Chris for stealing his car
S14E05

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
A failure to stop in Hartlepool turns into an armed stand-off and a full-blown kidnapping situation, while a 14-year-old boy is found in possession of a bag of crack cocaine, cash and a knife. Lee goes on a high-speed pursuit through Stockton, and Jacko and Simon tackle a drug driver who is wearing a balaclava
S14E06

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc:
Concerned 999 callers report an HGV swerving all over the M6, so PCs Jamie Barlow and Amy Hollis team up to search for the vehicle in question. When they finally catch up with the driver, they discover the awful truth behind his dangerous driving. On the M56, two trucks have collided near Cheshire Oaks, with reports that one of the drivers may have suffered a heart attack, so Inspector Anton Sullivan races to the scene of the crash to find out exactly what happened
S03E08

programme.title: Police: Hour of Duty
programme.desc:
999: Police Hour of Duty: A woman arrives in custody after being arrested on suspicion of causing harm to her baby. Suffering from multiple bleeds on the brain, the baby is in a critical condition, and police suspect that the parents are involved. Meanwhile, a task force heads out to raid a factory believed to be used for the large-scale production of cannabis and suspected of being linked to a major organised crime group. Police need to seize the grow and arrest anyone inside, but with the knowledge that these gang members are violent and have weapons, will the officers manage to successfully execute the raid unharmed?
S03E05

programme.title: World's Deadliest Weather: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:
Horrific wildfires devastate Greece, hikers in Turkey are stranded by a flash flood and a tornado rips off roofs and catapults cars in Canada
S03E03

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
A van thief gives officers from Lincolnshire's Roads Policing Unit the runaround before taking a disastrous wrong turn. Dan joins a manhunt but finds dodgy diesel instead, while Jon wades into a late-night assault involving a pair of TV legends. Big Jim reports a boy racer to his mum and delivers a dressing down to a driver with a taste for rude gestures
S06E05

programme.title: UK's Strongest Man
programme.desc:
Action from the Group B quarter-final at Stadium MK in Milton Keynes, where last year's runner-up Paul Smith was among those in action. The five best athletes after three events progressed to the semi-finals, with the bottom three going into the sudden death eliminator
S2022E02

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:
999: Criminals Caught on Camera: Why cameras are proving useful when it comes to controlling rowdy football fans on trains. Plus, footage of angry drivers violently attacking cyclists
S05E07

programme.title: Sinkholes: Buried Underground
programme.desc:
Sinkholes: Documentary examining the underlying forces behind sinkholes, which can swallow streets, rip up motorways and even drag unfortunate bystanders to their deaths
S02E12

programme.title: Sewermen
programme.desc:
Two miles off the coast of Blackpool, specialist divers are on an underwater mission to clean a massive submerged outfall pipe that disperses treated wastewater deep into the sea. Water tester Annette is out in harsh Cumbrian weather to perform vital checks on the water quality in her area and sewage supremos Mick and Ash race to the aid of a family whose backyard is swimming with sewage from a bunged-up manhole
S02E12

programme.title: Red Shoe Diaries
programme.desc:
Liar's Tale: A photo journalist falls victim to the glamorous life of a call-girl
S02E07

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
During a dramatic pursuit, Faulko is rammed off the road at 80mph and has to be rushed to hospital, while the team battles to tackle the aftermath of the crash, and track down the driver responsible. Meanwhile, timing is everything as Liam locks up a rogue biker with the help of patience, pepper spray and the actions of a heroic passer-by
S14E08

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Dog handler Darren calls on all his powers of persuasion to try to end a roof-top stand-off, and Steve is forced to use his pepper spray when a suspect refuses to come quietly. Plus, there is a tense stand-off with a man armed with a knife
S14E09

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Chris and the team are in pursuit of a stolen Mazda M3, but the driver disappears into an industrial area and tracker dog Ronny tries to track down the villain. Meanwhile, a routine stop and search takes a dangerous turn for Jimmy, and Liam helps take down a banned driver who causes carnage at a red light
S14E10

programme.title: Escape to Victory (1981)
programme.desc: Allied PoWs take to the football field when a group of Nazi officers comes up with the idea to have them take on a German team for a propaganda event. However, the prisoners see a chance to escape during the match. Second World War adventure, with Michael Caine, Sylvester Stallone, Max von Sydow and Daniel Massey. Soccer legends also making appearances include Pele, Bobby Moore and Ossie Ardiles

programme.title: The Jumbo Jet: 50 Years in the Sky
programme.desc:
How They Built the Jumbo Jet: Documentary celebrating the Boeing 747 and examines the lasting impact of 'the plane that shrank the world'. The first of two episodes explores the story behind the 747's design, revealing some of the challenges faced during its initial construction. The project very nearly led Boeing into bankruptcy, as they raced to meet an ambitious delivery deadline
S01E01

programme.desc:

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Liam and Ben attempt to catch a gang of late-night burglars, but one of the suspects treats an officer to a face full of saliva, while Jacko and Simon are in pursuit of a car round the streets of Ferryhill, but it's not the interceptors who make the arrest. Meanwhile, Spike tails two suspected burglars in an unmarked car before making a back-street stop and Liam's sniffer dog Louie uncovers large amounts of cash and drugs following an armed raid

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Officers pursue a fleeing Vauxhall Astra through the streets of north Hartlepool at more than 100mph, but are forced to call the chase off and the driver later robs a supermarket at knife-point, sparking a huge manhunt. Liam and his sniffer dog Louie take part in the search of a house that uncovers thousands in cash and nearly 500,000 in class A drugs, while firearms officers rush to Guisborough at 11pm on a Friday after a caller claims that a man with a shotgun is walking around the town
S14E13

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Documentary following the work of elite crime-fighting units, this time riding along with officers covering the West Yorkshire region. In the first edition, Jo and Mike track down a VW Golf that was involved in a robbery to a petrol station, but as they try to stop the driver, the fleeing car slams into Jo and then smashes through the pumps in a desperate bid to escape
S15E01

programme.title: Trucking Hell
programme.desc:
Return of the documentary following workers in the heavy recovery business. In Corby a 16-metre lorry loaded with waste flips over near a busy roundabout
S06E01

programme.title: World's Deadliest Weather: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:
Hurricane Michael hits Florida, a group of fishermen capsize in rough seas and a police officer is hurt by a car careering out of control in the snow

programme.title: WWE: Raw Highlights
programme.desc:
Wrestling action with the superstars of WWE, including Drew McIntyre, AJ Styles, Becky Lynch, Randy Orton and Seth Rollins. Presented by Tom Phillips, Samoa Joe and Byron Saxton
S01E161

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Dog handler Jon is forced to wrestle with a drunk man on the high street in Lincoln and Dan has an early morning encounter with a driver who is over the limit. Elsewhere, a wine-loving shoplifter gets his just desserts, Mark pulls over a juggernaut in jeopardy on the A1, and the helicopter is scrambled to chase down a car thief

programme.title: UK's Strongest Man

programme.title: Doomsday: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:
A Twister on a Rampage and More: A boat trip takes a terrifying turn when a volcano erupts, an onlooker witness the power and destruction of a raging flash flood and an avalanche buries a family and their truck

programme.title: The Jumbo Jet: 50 Years in the Sky
programme.desc:
How They Built the Jumbo Jet: The concluding part of the documentary celebrating the Boeing 747 looks at the social history of the airliner's working life, from its first commercial flight in 1970 up to the present day. The programme examines the part it played in democratising air travel and creating long-haul for all, taking a nostalgic journey from the glamorous age of the jet set to the no-frills air travel of today
S01E02

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:
Journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces around the nation to discover how CCTV and technological advances are helping to bring criminals to justice. The programme reveals how essential surveillance cameras have become in the fight against crime and features footage of people caught red-handed
S01E05

programme.desc:

When they finally catch up with the driver, they discover the awful truth behind his dangerous driving. On the M56, two trucks have collided near Cheshire Oaks, with reports that one of the drivers may have suffered a heart attack, so Inspector Anton Sullivan races to the scene of the crash to find out exactly what happened

programme.title: Concorde: 120 Seconds to Disaster
programme.desc: Detailing the events of 25 July, 2000, when Air France Flight 4590 crashed shortly after taking off from Charles de Gaulle Airport, Paris, resulting in the deaths of 113 people. Most of the wreckage was consumed by fire, but three mysterious clues were found on the runway - a ruptured fuel tank, some torn pieces of tyre, and a mysterious strip of metal. This documentary made almost 20 years after the event reveals how French investigators used this curious collection of clues to determine the cause. This was the first-ever fatal accident involving a Concorde, the world's only supersonic passenger airliner, but nevertheless led to an immediate cessation of the aircraft's use and ultimately contributed to its withdrawal from service almost four years later

programme.desc:

The project very nearly led Boeing into bankruptcy, as they raced to meet an ambitious delivery deadline

programme.title: The Jumbo Jet: 50 Years in the Sky
programme.desc:
How They Built the Jumbo Jet: The concluding part of the documentary celebrating the Boeing 747 looks at the social history of the airliner's working life, from its first commercial flight in 1970 up to the present day. The programme examines the part it played in democratising air travel and creating long-haul for all, taking a nostalgic journey from the glamorous age of the jet set to the no-frills air travel of today

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: 27/02/2023: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc:
27/02/2023: Gethin Jones and Kym Marsh host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice
S04E173

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc:
Dominic Littlewood presents the story of an anxious family's 999 call to the police as they watched an intruder prowling around downstairs, live on their home security camera
S11E06

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc:
A house fire ends in tragedy when an attempt to cash-in on an insurance payout goes terribly wrong, and a window cleaner who says he cannot work is caught out on camera
S13E01

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc:
Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell visit two neighbouring cottages in Derbyshire, a terrace in Bolton and a semi in Leeds before they are sold under the hammer
S24E23

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Peterborough 13: Christina Trevanion and the teams shop for antiques in Peterborough, where experts Catherine Southon and Kate Bliss are on hand to help with the search. Christina flummoxes the fairgoers with a 2,000-year-old antique, and then it's off to Lichfield for the day's auction

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: Look East
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc:
Hearts and Minds: Rob treats Karen to a special night while Kirsty and Rich come to an understanding. Emma encourages Luca to talk to Jamie and Ruhma goes on a blind date
S24E22

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc:
Mid Devon Show, Sheep: For Louise and Olly, a prize for their Beltex sheep at the Mid Devon Show is vital for their future. Amelia and Ben's Charollais sheep also meet the best breeders in the country
S06E16

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc:
Wiltshire: Nicki Chapman helps a London couple on their country house hunt in Wiltshire. They have a generous 1million budget to afford them space for their prized possessions - a baby grand piano and classic cars. Away from the property search, Nicki discovers more about the art of wooden hat block making, a critically endangered heritage craft being kept alive by a Wiltshire-based family whose blocks are used by milliners across the world
S19E10

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc:
Dealers Irita Marriot and Mark Hill set out on their first trip together. Irita buys a very rare tea-set, while Mark invests in mid-century Italian ceramics
S26E11

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc:
Quiz show hosted by Ross Kemp in which contestants compete for cash by crossing a bridge made up of stepping stones, each of which has a different option. The players must try to get from A to B by stepping on the truths and avoiding the lies in order to cross the studio floor safely, or risk falling off the bridge and out of the game
S01E01

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc:
Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman
S27E37

programme.title: BBC News at Six
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Look East
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: The One Show

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Manchester City v Newcastle United at Etihad Stadium and Arsenal v Bournemouth at Emirates Stadium. The Citizens and Newcastle shared the spoils in a thrilling 3-3 draw at St James' Park in August, but the champions will have hoped to make home advantage count this time around. Arsenal are battling City for the title, and will have expected a second win of the season against the Cherries. programme.desc: Women of Faith: To mark International Women's Day, Claire McCollum visits Glasgow to uncover stories of women of faith throughout the ages, including the city's very own St Enochh, a Scottish princess in the 6th century who survived attempted murder and rape before giving birth to Glasgow's founder, Saint Mungo. Laura Wright meets Glaswegian women who are putting their faith into action

programme.title: Match of the Day Live
programme.desc: Chelsea v Arsenal (Kick-off 3.00pm). All the action from the showpiece match at Selhurst Park. Last season's runners-up Chelsea were in fine form in the semi-finals as they demolished West Ham 7-0 away from home, with Australian star Sam Kerr scoring four of the goals. The Gunners had to work harder for victory in their last-four match, with Stina Blackstenius' extra-time strike enough to give them a 1-0 win over holders Manchester City

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts: A Natural History
programme.desc: Stephen Fry attempts to unfurl all sorts of mysteries around extraordinary beasts and real-life creatures across history, which it is hard to believe could possibly exist. Visiting locations from Utah, USA, to Loch Ness in Scotland, the actor delves into the mythological - such as dragons, mermaids and unicorns - alongside examinations of natural world beasts, such as vervet monkeys, narwhals and manatees. Stephen also chats to JK Rowling about the inspirations behind the creatures populating her hit novels and to visual effects supervisor Christian Manz, who has brought countless magical creations to life

This market is also important for John, a third-generation Sussex fruit farmer. As well as picking his finest fresh fruit, he also makes apple juice so he can pocket as many sales as possible. With over 1,000 potential customers expected, the farmers hope it will prove to be a lucrative day. Narrated by Denis Lawson

The Gunners had to work harder for victory in their last-four match, with Stina Blackstenius' extra-time strike enough to give them a 1-0 win over holders Manchester City

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts: A Natural History
programme.desc: Stephen Fry attempts to unfurl all sorts of mysteries around extraordinary beasts and real-life creatures across history, which it is hard to believe could possibly exist. Visiting locations from Utah, USA, to Loch Ness in Scotland, the actor delves into the mythological - such as dragons, mermaids and unicorns - alongside examinations of natural world beasts, such as vervet monkeys, narwhals and manatees. Stephen also chats to JK Rowling about the inspirations behind the creatures populating her hit novels and to visual effects supervisor Christian Manz, who has brought countless magical creations to life

For the final crossing, those who have been successful join forces for a chance to take home the money for their chosen charities

programme.desc:

S15E16

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc:

Rash is left struggling with his Dad's welfare after his carer is attacked
S37E21

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc:
Bust Up: Lee Mack and Sally Bretton star in the domestic comedy which sees the couple appear to go from one disaster to the next, while coping with their three kids, Lucy's disapproving parents, Lee's feckless dad Frank and their world-weary friends Toby and Anna. In this final episode, Lucy begins to consider having a breast augmentation, encouraged by Anna, wondering whether it will help her regain some of the femininity she felt in her youth. With Abigail Cruttenden and Hugh Dennis
S09E07

programme.desc: Women of Faith: To mark International Women's Day, Claire McCollum visits Glasgow to uncover stories of women of faith throughout the ages, including the city's very own St Enochh, a Scottish princess in the 6th century who survived attempted murder and rape before giving birth to Glasgow's founder, Saint Mungo. programme.title: Match of the Day Live
programme.desc: Chelsea v Arsenal (Kick-off 3.00pm). All the action from the showpiece match at Selhurst Park. Last season's runners-up Chelsea were in fine form in the semi-finals as they demolished West Ham 7-0 away from home, with Australian star Sam Kerr scoring four of the goals. The Gunners had to work harder for victory in their last-four match, with Stina Blackstenius' extra-time strike enough to give them a 1-0 win over holders Manchester City

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts: A Natural History
programme.desc: Stephen Fry attempts to unfurl all sorts of mysteries around extraordinary beasts and real-life creatures across history, which it is hard to believe could possibly exist. Visiting locations from Utah, USA, to Loch Ness in Scotland, the actor delves into the mythological - such as dragons, mermaids and unicorns - alongside examinations of natural world beasts, such as vervet monkeys, narwhals and manatees. Stephen also chats to JK Rowling about the inspirations behind the creatures populating her hit novels and to visual effects supervisor Christian Manz, who has brought countless magical creations to life

The Gunners had to work harder for victory in their last-four match, with Stina Blackstenius' extra-time strike enough to give them a 1-0 win over holders Manchester City

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts: A Natural History
programme.desc: Stephen Fry attempts to unfurl all sorts of mysteries around extraordinary beasts and real-life creatures across history, which it is hard to believe could possibly exist. Visiting locations from Utah, USA, to Loch Ness in Scotland, the actor delves into the mythological - such as dragons, mermaids and unicorns - alongside examinations of natural world beasts, such as vervet monkeys, narwhals and manatees. Stephen also chats to JK Rowling about the inspirations behind the creatures populating her hit novels and to visual effects supervisor Christian Manz, who has brought countless magical creations to life

programme.desc: Chelsea v Arsenal (Kick-off 3.00pm). All the action from the showpiece match at Selhurst Park. Last season's runners-up Chelsea were in fine form in the semi-finals as they demolished West Ham 7-0 away from home, with Australian star Sam Kerr scoring four of the goals. The Gunners had to work harder for victory in their last-four match, with Stina Blackstenius' extra-time strike enough to give them a 1-0 win over holders Manchester City

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts: A Natural History
programme.desc: Stephen Fry attempts to unfurl all sorts of mysteries around extraordinary beasts and real-life creatures across history, which it is hard to believe could possibly exist. Visiting locations from Utah, USA, to Loch Ness in Scotland, the actor delves into the mythological - such as dragons, mermaids and unicorns - alongside examinations of natural world beasts, such as vervet monkeys, narwhals and manatees. Stephen also chats to JK Rowling about the inspirations behind the creatures populating her hit novels and to visual effects supervisor Christian Manz, who has brought countless magical creations to life

Last season's runners-up Chelsea were in fine form in the semi-finals as they demolished West Ham 7-0 away from home, with Australian star Sam Kerr scoring four of the goals. The Gunners had to work harder for victory in their last-four match, with Stina Blackstenius' extra-time strike enough to give them a 1-0 win over holders Manchester City

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts: A Natural History
programme.desc: Stephen Fry attempts to unfurl all sorts of mysteries around extraordinary beasts and real-life creatures across history, which it is hard to believe could possibly exist. Visiting locations from Utah, USA, to Loch Ness in Scotland, the actor delves into the mythological - such as dragons, mermaids and unicorns - alongside examinations of natural world beasts, such as vervet monkeys, narwhals and manatees. Stephen also chats to JK Rowling about the inspirations behind the creatures populating her hit novels and to visual effects supervisor Christian Manz, who has brought countless magical creations to life

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Fulham v Leeds United (Kick-off 7.45pm). Gary Lineker presents all the action from the fifth-round tie at Craven Cottage. Goals by Aleksandar Mitrovic, Bobby Decordova-Reid and Willian helped Fulham record a 3-2 win when the sides met in the Premier League at Elland Road in October. They will be hopeful of recording a second victory of the season against United now they have home advantage, but Leeds may see this tie as a welcome distraction from their struggles in the Premier League. With analysis from Micah Richards, Danny Murphy and Jermaine Beckford

Martha prepares for the launch of her caf, but is thrown when a face from the past shows up. Death in Paradise spin-off, starring Kris Marshall and Sally Bretton and featuring Ruth Madoc in one of her final TV roles

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc:
Written in Murder: Famous thriller author Frank O'Toole is found stabbed through the heart after taking an early morning swim in the ocean. Suspicion soon falls on the victim's wife Valerie, but with eyewitnesses confirming he was swimming alone, how could anyone have got from the house to the sea without being detected? Away from the investigation, Dwayne concentrates on finding a date for a voodoo love festival. Whodunit, guest starring Simon Callow, Imogen Stubbs, and Sian Gibson of Car Share fame

programme.desc: Stephen Fry attempts to unfurl all sorts of mysteries around extraordinary beasts and real-life creatures across history, which it is hard to believe could possibly exist. Visiting locations from Utah, USA, to Loch Ness in Scotland, the actor delves into the mythological - such as dragons, mermaids and unicorns - alongside examinations of natural world beasts, such as vervet monkeys, narwhals and manatees. Stephen also chats to JK Rowling about the inspirations behind the creatures populating her hit novels and to visual effects supervisor Christian Manz, who has brought countless magical creations to life

Spurs are aiming for their first triumph in this competition since 1991 and recorded a 3-0 win away to another Championship side in Preston North End in the previous round. With analysis from Alan Shearer, Jermaine Jenas and Chris Wilder

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc:

Away from the investigation, Dwayne concentrates on finding a date for a voodoo love festival. Whodunit, guest starring Simon Callow, Imogen Stubbs, and Sian Gibson of Car Share fame

The Gunners had to work harder for victory in their last-four match, with Stina Blackstenius' extra-time strike enough to give them a 1-0 win over holders Manchester City

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts: A Natural History
programme.desc: Stephen Fry attempts to unfurl all sorts of mysteries around extraordinary beasts and real-life creatures across history, which it is hard to believe could possibly exist. Visiting locations from Utah, USA, to Loch Ness in Scotland, the actor delves into the mythological - such as dragons, mermaids and unicorns - alongside examinations of natural world beasts, such as vervet monkeys, narwhals and manatees. Stephen also chats to JK Rowling about the inspirations behind the creatures populating her hit novels and to visual effects supervisor Christian Manz, who has brought countless magical creations to life

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Women of Faith: To mark International Women's Day, Claire McCollum visits Glasgow to uncover stories of women of faith throughout the ages, including the city's very own St Enochh, a Scottish princess in the 6th century who survived attempted murder and rape before giving birth to Glasgow's founder, Saint Mungo. Laura Wright meets Glaswegian women who are putting their faith into action

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph is in Surrey, rummaging through the rubbish at the Earlswood Recycling Centre. She enlists the help of Duncan McKean to transform an antique floor lamp and a trolley

programme.title: Match of the Day Live
programme.desc: Chelsea v Arsenal (Kick-off 3.00pm). All the action from the showpiece match at Selhurst Park. Last season's runners-up Chelsea were in fine form in the semi-finals as they demolished West Ham 7-0 away from home, with Australian star Sam Kerr scoring four of the goals. The Gunners had to work harder for victory in their last-four match, with Stina Blackstenius' extra-time strike enough to give them a 1-0 win over holders Manchester City

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts: A Natural History
programme.desc: Stephen Fry attempts to unfurl all sorts of mysteries around extraordinary beasts and real-life creatures across history, which it is hard to believe could possibly exist. Visiting locations from Utah, USA, to Loch Ness in Scotland, the actor delves into the mythological - such as dragons, mermaids and unicorns - alongside examinations of natural world beasts, such as vervet monkeys, narwhals and manatees. Stephen also chats to JK Rowling about the inspirations behind the creatures populating her hit novels and to visual effects supervisor Christian Manz, who has brought countless magical creations to life

programme.title: South Today
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Vanishing Villages: John Craven and Matt Baker are on the east coast of England to find out how storms are devouring the coastline, putting homes and livelihoods at threat. Tom Heap is in East Anglia, investigating the threat to Britain's breadbasket, while Adam Henson looks into the impact of new farm payments. In the first of a four-part strand, Adrian Chiles is in North Wales, finding out just what it takes to be a hill farmer

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc:
The Eden Project, Cornwall 1: Fiona Bruce presents an episode filmed before the Accession, featuring the Queen Consort's visit to the Eden Project to discuss charity project The Big Lunch. Silver specialist Duncan Campbell takes a look at a rare snuffbox from the Royal Collection that was made from Cornish silver, while books expert Justin Croft admires a copy of Gray's Elegy in a Country Churchyard
S45E07

programme.title: The Gold
programme.desc:
Vengeance Is Easy, Justice Is Hard: Palmer, who went to Tenerife on holiday with his family just before his attempted arrest, learns the police want to speak to him and publicly states his innocence in a television interview. Cooper and Parry successfully move the remaining criminal proceeds from Switzerland to Liechtenstein, but their courier gets caught at the border with the cash. Noye's murder trial comes to a dramatic conclusion
S01E04

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman reviews the day's Premier League action, featuring Liverpool v Manchester United at Anfield and Nottingham Forest v Everton at the City Ground. United were looking to do the double over their fierce rivals for the first time since 2015/16 season after prevailing 2-1 when the sides met at Old Trafford in August. Forest and Everton shared the spoils in a 1-1 draw at Goodison Park, but both teams will have been looking for all three points on this occasion to help ease any relegation concerns. Plus, a round-up of yesterday's goals

programme.title: Fast Girls (2012)
programme.desc: A fierce rivalry develops between a talented working-class sprinter and the wealthy daughter of a former Olympic medal-winner as they compete on the track. They are forced to settle their differences and work together when they are recruited for the same relay team. Drama, with Lily James, Lenora Crichlow, Rupert Graves and Noel Clarke, who also co-wrote the script

The Gunners had to work harder for victory in their last-four match, with Stina Blackstenius' extra-time strike enough to give them a 1-0 win over holders Manchester City

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts: A Natural History
programme.desc: Stephen Fry attempts to unfurl all sorts of mysteries around extraordinary beasts and real-life creatures across history, which it is hard to believe could possibly exist. Visiting locations from Utah, USA, to Loch Ness in Scotland, the actor delves into the mythological - such as dragons, mermaids and unicorns - alongside examinations of natural world beasts, such as vervet monkeys, narwhals and manatees. Stephen also chats to JK Rowling about the inspirations behind the creatures populating her hit novels and to visual effects supervisor Christian Manz, who has brought countless magical creations to life

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Manchester City v Newcastle United at Etihad Stadium and Arsenal v Bournemouth at Emirates Stadium. The Citizens and Newcastle shared the spoils in a thrilling 3-3 draw at St James' Park in August, but the champions will have hoped to make home advantage count this time around. Arsenal are battling City for the title, and will have expected a second win of the season against the Cherries. Plus, Aston Villa v Crystal Palace, Brighton & Hove Albion v West Ham United, Chelsea v Leeds United, Wolverhampton Wanderers v Tottenham Hotspur and Southampton v Leicester City

programme.title: Going in Style (2017)
programme.desc: Joe Harding, Willie Davis and Albert Garner are lifelong friends who have been swindled out of their pension money by a Brooklyn bank. So the seasoned pals decide to steal their cash back in a daring robbery. Director Zach Braff's remake of George Burns's 1979 heist caper, starring Morgan Freeman, Michael Caine and Alan Arkin

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Women of Faith: To mark International Women's Day, Claire McCollum visits Glasgow to uncover stories of women of faith throughout the ages, including the city's very own St Enochh, a Scottish princess in the 6th century who survived attempted murder and rape before giving birth to Glasgow's founder, Saint Mungo. Laura Wright meets Glaswegian women who are putting their faith into action

programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph is in Surrey, rummaging through the rubbish at the Earlswood Recycling Centre. She enlists the help of Duncan McKean to transform an antique floor lamp and a trolley

programme.title: Match of the Day Live
programme.desc: Chelsea v Arsenal (Kick-off 3.00pm). All the action from the showpiece match at Selhurst Park. Last season's runners-up Chelsea were in fine form in the semi-finals as they demolished West Ham 7-0 away from home, with Australian star Sam Kerr scoring four of the goals. The Gunners had to work harder for victory in their last-four match, with Stina Blackstenius' extra-time strike enough to give them a 1-0 win over holders Manchester City

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts: A Natural History
programme.desc: Stephen Fry attempts to unfurl all sorts of mysteries around extraordinary beasts and real-life creatures across history, which it is hard to believe could possibly exist. Visiting locations from Utah, USA, to Loch Ness in Scotland, the actor delves into the mythological - such as dragons, mermaids and unicorns - alongside examinations of natural world beasts, such as vervet monkeys, narwhals and manatees. Stephen also chats to JK Rowling about the inspirations behind the creatures populating her hit novels and to visual effects supervisor Christian Manz, who has brought countless magical creations to life

programme.desc: Stephen Fry attempts to unfurl all sorts of mysteries around extraordinary beasts and real-life creatures across history, which it is hard to believe could possibly exist. Stephen also chats to JK Rowling about the inspirations behind the creatures populating her hit novels and to visual effects supervisor Christian Manz, who has brought countless magical creations to life

The Gunners had to work harder for victory in their last-four match, with Stina Blackstenius' extra-time strike enough to give them a 1-0 win over holders Manchester City

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts: A Natural History
programme.desc: Stephen Fry attempts to unfurl all sorts of mysteries around extraordinary beasts and real-life creatures across history, which it is hard to believe could possibly exist. Visiting locations from Utah, USA, to Loch Ness in Scotland, the actor delves into the mythological - such as dragons, mermaids and unicorns - alongside examinations of natural world beasts, such as vervet monkeys, narwhals and manatees. Stephen also chats to JK Rowling about the inspirations behind the creatures populating her hit novels and to visual effects supervisor Christian Manz, who has brought countless magical creations to life

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Fulham v Leeds United (Kick-off 7.45pm). Gary Lineker presents all the action from the fifth-round tie at Craven Cottage. Goals by Aleksandar Mitrovic, Bobby Decordova-Reid and Willian helped Fulham record a 3-2 win when the sides met in the Premier League at Elland Road in October. They will be hopeful of recording a second victory of the season against United now they have home advantage, but Leeds may see this tie as a welcome distraction from their struggles in the Premier League. With analysis from Micah Richards, Danny Murphy and Jermaine Beckford

programme.title: Beyond Paradise
programme.desc:
Humphrey and Martha throw themselves into work in an attempt to distract themselves from recent events. For Humphrey, this means investigating one of the strangest cases he's ever encountered - an entire family has vanished, leaving their TV and lights on and dinner half-eaten. Martha prepares for the launch of her caf, but is thrown when a face from the past shows up. programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc:

Suspicion soon falls on the victim's wife Valerie, but with eyewitnesses confirming he was swimming alone, how could anyone have got from the house to the sea without being detected? Away from the investigation, Dwayne concentrates on finding a date for a voodoo love festival. Whodunit, guest starring Simon Callow, Imogen Stubbs, and Sian Gibson of Car Share fame

programme.desc: Chelsea v Arsenal (Kick-off 3.00pm). All the action from the showpiece match at Selhurst Park. Last season's runners-up Chelsea were in fine form in the semi-finals as they demolished West Ham 7-0 away from home, with Australian star Sam Kerr scoring four of the goals. The Gunners had to work harder for victory in their last-four match, with Stina Blackstenius' extra-time strike enough to give them a 1-0 win over holders Manchester City

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts: A Natural History
programme.desc: Stephen Fry attempts to unfurl all sorts of mysteries around extraordinary beasts and real-life creatures across history, which it is hard to believe could possibly exist. Visiting locations from Utah, USA, to Loch Ness in Scotland, the actor delves into the mythological - such as dragons, mermaids and unicorns - alongside examinations of natural world beasts, such as vervet monkeys, narwhals and manatees. Stephen also chats to JK Rowling about the inspirations behind the creatures populating her hit novels and to visual effects supervisor Christian Manz, who has brought countless magical creations to life

The Gunners had to work harder for victory in their last-four match, with Stina Blackstenius' extra-time strike enough to give them a 1-0 win over holders Manchester City

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts: A Natural History
programme.desc: Stephen Fry attempts to unfurl all sorts of mysteries around extraordinary beasts and real-life creatures across history, which it is hard to believe could possibly exist. Visiting locations from Utah, USA, to Loch Ness in Scotland, the actor delves into the mythological - such as dragons, mermaids and unicorns - alongside examinations of natural world beasts, such as vervet monkeys, narwhals and manatees. Stephen also chats to JK Rowling about the inspirations behind the creatures populating her hit novels and to visual effects supervisor Christian Manz, who has brought countless magical creations to life

Vengeance Is Easy, Justice Is Hard: Palmer, who went to Tenerife on holiday with his family just before his attempted arrest, learns the police want to speak to him and publicly states his innocence in a television interview. Cooper and Parry successfully move the remaining criminal proceeds from Switzerland to Liechtenstein, but their courier gets caught at the border with the cash. Noye's murder trial comes to a dramatic conclusion

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman reviews the day's Premier League action, featuring Liverpool v Manchester United at Anfield and Nottingham Forest v Everton at the City Ground. United were looking to do the double over their fierce rivals for the first time since 2015/16 season after prevailing 2-1 when the sides met at Old Trafford in August. Forest and Everton shared the spoils in a 1-1 draw at Goodison Park, but both teams will have been looking for all three points on this occasion to help ease any relegation concerns. Plus, a round-up of yesterday's goals

programme.desc:
Iagan MacNeil finds out about the landscape and history along the St Cuthbert's Way, starting off at Melrose Abbey, where he talks to Iain Craig of Historic Environment Scotland. The 62-mile long pilgrims' route - named after the seventh-century hermit, healer and bishop St Cuthbert - links Melrose Abbey in the Scottish Borders where Cuthbert began his religious life, with his original burial place on the Holy Island of Lindisfarne off the Northumbrian coast

programme.title: Slighe Naoimh Cuithbeirt/St Cuthberts Way
programme.desc:
Iagan MacNeil finds out about the landscape and history along the St Cuthbert's Way, starting off at Melrose Abbey, where he talks to Iain Craig of Historic Environment Scotland. The 62-mile long pilgrims' route - named after the seventh-century hermit, healer and bishop St Cuthbert - links Melrose Abbey in the Scottish Borders where Cuthbert began his religious life, with his original burial place on the Holy Island of Lindisfarne off the Northumbrian coast
S01E01

programme.title: Sar Sgeoil

programme.title: Trusadh (Compelling Stories)
programme.desc:

S11E06

programme.title: Mach Seo!
programme.desc:
Ramsay MacMahon is in Ayrshire, where he visits Mauchline - former home of Scotland's very own Rabbie Burns - and learns all about the town's connection to curling. He also makes for the coastal town of Ayr for a Burns-inspired dinner on the beach, and faces his fears of enclosed dark spaces at the sea caves under Culzean Castle
S06E04

programme.title: 'San Fhuil (It's in the Blood)
programme.desc:
A personal portrait of a South Uist crofting township where the Greylag geese outnumber people by three to one. Over the last 30 years, the resident population of Greylags has increased from less than 1,000 to over 9,000 birds. With little to check the breeding Greylag, the geese are destroying the cultivation of Uist corn
S01E03

programme.title: Seid a' Chidsin - The Kitchen Coves
programme.desc:
isdean MacLeod and Roddy Munro prepare a picnic for a trip to Harris, throwing in a raised pork pie, couscous and salmon scotch eggs made in the barn kitchen
S07E06

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
York to Frizinghall: Armed with his Edwardian Bradshaw's guide, Michael Portillo conducts important research in an historic tea room, built by an Edwardian immigrant to the city of York. In Leeds he discovers the city's textile heritage, and also investigates Bradford's musical heritage
S09E12

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc:
Tropical Seascape: American artist Bob Ross offers further advice as he paints a tropical seascape - an exotic ocean masterpiece complete with palm trees swaying in the warm breeze
S01E24

programme.title: Da Vinci: The Lost Treasure
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce travels to Florence, Milan, Paris and Warsaw to tell the story of Leonardo da Vinci's life, exploring why a man whose reputation rests on only a few pictures - including the Mona Lisa - is regarded as one of the greatest painters of all time. She also visits New York to see a recently discovered piece by the artist

programme.title: Art of France
programme.desc:
Plus Ca Change: Andrew Graham-Dixon examines the history of French art, revealing how it emerged from a struggle between tradition and revolution, and rulers and citizens. Starting with the invention of Gothic architecture, he traces its development up until the arrival of Classicism and the Age of Enlightenment
S01E01

programme.title: Bent Coppers: Crossing the Line of Duty
programme.desc:
Firm in a Firm: Documentary examining corruption in the police in the 1970s, revealing a secret network of officers was operating illegally throughout London and led to the formation of the first internal anti-corruption unit A10, which inspired the BBC drama Line of Duty. The story begins in 1969, when a desperate south London criminal tipped off the Times about how he was being extorted for money by a detective in the Metropolitan Police
S01E01

programme.title: Big Sky, Big Dreams, Big Art: Made in the USA
programme.desc:
Waldemar Januszczak focuses on the art of the new cities of the east coast of America, with their futuristic skylines and lofty skyscrapers. He explores the squalid boxing rings painted by George Bellows, Reginald Mash's decadent away days on Coney Island and the escape into theosophy and abstraction mounted by Thomas Wilfred. He ends by looking at the harsh immigrant experience of Ellis Island and the profound impact that rootlessness had on the art of Mark Rothko.
S01E02

programme.title: The Story of Welsh Art
programme.desc:
Huw Stephens reveals how, as the 20th century dawned, artists found radical new ways to depict Wales, pushing themselves to extremes and redefining what art could be. His venture takes him to the National Museum Wales in Cardiff, Bardsey Island off the Llyn Peninsula, Colwyn Bay and Swansea
S01E03

programme.title: Romancing the Stone: The Golden Ages of British Sculpture
programme.desc:
Mavericks of Empire: Alastair Sooke tells the stories of sculptors John Flaxman, Francis Chantrey and Alfred Gilbert, who bucked trends in the 18th and 19th centuries. He examines the technical breakthroughs behind their key works - such as carving in marble with a pointer machine and the lost-wax technique - which were produced at a time of increased interest in sculptural projects to celebrate the size of the British Empire
S01E02

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
York to Frizinghall: Armed with his Edwardian Bradshaw's guide, Michael Portillo conducts important research in an historic tea room, built by an Edwardian immigrant to the city of York. In Leeds he discovers the city's textile heritage, and also investigates Bradford's musical heritage
S09E12

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc:
Tropical Seascape: American artist Bob Ross offers further advice as he paints a tropical seascape - an exotic ocean masterpiece complete with palm trees swaying in the warm breeze
S01E24

programme.title: Art of France
programme.desc:
Plus Ca Change: Andrew Graham-Dixon examines the history of French art, revealing how it emerged from a struggle between tradition and revolution, and rulers and citizens. Starting with the invention of Gothic architecture, he traces its development up until the arrival of Classicism and the Age of Enlightenment
S01E01

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Sheffield to Nantwich: Michael Portillo travels to the steel city of Sheffield where he discovers an early 20th century steam engine which produced armour plates for a Royal Navy warship. Then, Michael heads south into Nottinghamshire and to the former pit village of Eastwood, before arriving in Nantwich, where he takes a dip in the briny
S09E13

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc:
Mountain at Sunset: Bob Ross demonstrates the creation of the perfect brown-toned scene of a mountain at sunset
S01E25

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc:
The Copper Kettle: Lionel and Jean spend a nostalgic day in Buckinghamshire reliving their courtship days - but find things have changed in the intervening years. However, certain treasured memories remain. Originally shown in 1992
S01E03

programme.title: The Mistress
programme.desc:
The second series of Carla Lane's love triangle comedy, starring Felicity Kendal, Peter McEnery and Jane Asher. From 1987
S02E02

programme.title: A History of Britain by Simon Schama
programme.desc:
The British Wars (1603-1649): A chronicle of the English Civil War, revealing that behind the romantic stories of Cavaliers and Roundheads lies a terrible tale of tragedy and the death of innocents. The conflict saw hundreds of thousands of men, women and children killed, families torn apart and the nation divided, culminating in the public execution of King Charles I and the rise of Cromwell as Lord Protector
S01E08

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: An exploration of the process of filming sex scenes in Hollywood movies, the toll these scenes take on those involved and the impact on women and girls in the real world. The film features candid interviews with actors and film-makers including Jane Fonda, Rosanna Arquette, Joey Soloway, Angela Robinson, Karyn Kusama, Rose McGowan, Alexandra Billings, Emily Meade and David Simon, and highlights the voices of women who have spoken out against abusive behaviour on their sets and were punished for it

programme.title: Africa with Ade Adepitan
programme.desc:
Ade explores central Africa, travelling through Gabon, the Democratic Republic of Congo and Uganda. He investigates plans to develop a sustainable version of palm oil farming, meets a champion boxer helping to rehabilitate child soldiers, and talks to one of Africa's most outspoken political campaigners. He also reports on how conflict between militia groups influenced by foreign powers lies at the heart of the problems that have made the Democratic Republic of Congo arguably the most chaotic and corrupt country in Africa, as well as discovering how the conflict has impacted on the country's few remaining gorillas
S01E02

programme.title: Da Vinci: The Lost Treasure
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce travels to Florence, Milan, Paris and Warsaw to tell the story of Leonardo da Vinci's life, exploring why a man whose reputation rests on only a few pictures - including the Mona Lisa - is regarded as one of the greatest painters of all time. She also visits New York to see a recently discovered piece by the artist
