The story begins in 1969, when a desperate south London criminal tipped off the Times about how he was being extorted for money by a detective in the Metropolitan Police
S01E01

programme.title: A History of Britain by Simon Schama
programme.desc:
The British Wars (1603-1649): A chronicle of the English Civil War, revealing that behind the romantic stories of Cavaliers and Roundheads lies a terrible tale of tragedy and the death of innocents. The conflict saw hundreds of thousands of men, women and children killed, families torn apart and the nation divided, culminating in the public execution of King Charles I and the rise of Cromwell as Lord Protector
S01E08

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Liverpool to Dolgarrog: Michael Portillo travels between Liverpool and Wales. Along the way he discovers a childhood favourite - a miniature tank engine with three carriages in dark red - made by Frank Hornby, and learns the story of a Welsh countess who lived in Gwrych Castle. In Snowdonia, he also rides the waves with a Welsh surfing champion
S09E14

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc:
Soft Mountain Glow: American artist Bob Ross creates a tranquil landscape, almost feathery in appearance, at the base of a towering mountain
S01E26

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.desc:
Bridging the Gap: How the Severn Bridge Was Built: Liz Bonnin marks the 50th anniversary of the construction of the Severn Bridge in a Timeshift special telling the inside story of its design and construction. As the motorway link between England and Wales, the Severn Bridge was described as 'the most perfect suspension bridge in the world', and Liz reveals how its unique, slim-line structure came about by accident
S16E01

programme.title: Patagonia with Huw Edwards
programme.desc: The newsreader follows in the footsteps of settlers who travelled from Wales to Patagonia 150 years ago with the intention of creating a colony where their language and culture would endure. On arrival in South America, Huw meets descendants of the original immigrants and examines how much of their spirit lives on in the present

programme.title: Edge of Darkness
programme.desc:
Northmoor: Craven and Jedburgh follow in Emma's fateful footsteps and enter the nuclear facility of Northmoor, unaware the plant's security staff know they're on the way. Penultimate part of the award-winning thriller, starring Bob Peck
S01E05

programme.title: Edge of Darkness
programme.desc:
Fusion: Jedburgh obtains the plutonium which proves Northmoor has been running an illegal weapons plant, but he and Craven are exposed to deadly radiation. While waiting to die, they head for an international atomic energy conference for a final confrontation with Grogan. Troy Kennedy Martin's political thriller, starring Bob Peck, Joe Don Baker and Joanne Whalley
S01E06

programme.title: Peaky Blinders
programme.desc:
Black Day: Tommy sets off to North America, where the end of Prohibition brings opportunities, but he faces new danger from an old adversary who is finally making his move. In his Boston hotel room, Tommy takes a call and receives very concerning news, forcing him to cut short his trip and head straight back to Birmingham. Starring Cillian Murphy, Natasha O'Keeffe, Paul Anderson and Sophie Rundle
S06E01

programme.title: Peaky Blinders
programme.desc:
Black Shirt: Tommy gets involved in a power game when a Boston gangster comes to the UK on a fact-finding mission to take the political temperature in Europe - and to find a contact who can put him in touch with Mosley's fascists. As the various parties involved make their plans to double cross him, Tommy visits an old ally in Camden
S06E02

programme.title: Peaky Blinders
programme.desc:
Gold: As Ruby is rushed into hospital for urgent treatment for consumption, Tommy is more convinced than ever that his family has been cursed. He sets out on a journey to a gypsy camp to discover who is responsible and how his family might be saved. Ada takes charge of the situation, instructing Arthur to round up some new recruits and head to Liverpool to deliver a warning. Stephen Graham guest stars
S06E03

programme.title: Peaky Blinders
programme.desc:
Sapphire: Tommy and his allies gather in the wake of their recent losses and prepare to seek revenge on their enemies. He is driven to build a connection between crime and political power that could alter the course of history, bringing together an alliance of extremists from both sides of the Atlantic. However, he also receives life-changing news from an unexpected source, that leaves him dreading the prospect of war within the family
S06E04

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Criccieth to Caernarfon: In picturesque Snowdonia, Michael Portillo braves the fastest zip line in the world - stretching 1,500 feet across a vast slate quarry as he begins the last leg of his journey to Caernarfon. En route, he also visits the home of British mountaineering, Pen y Gwryd, to hear how an Edwardian journalist and poet created a climbing community, which grew to include men who would conquer Everest in the 1950s
S09E15

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc:
Bamburgh - Northumberland: Archaeologist Ben Robinson reveals how some of the nation's best-loved villages played a vital part in significant moments of history. He begins in Bamburgh in Northumberland, explaining how the health and fortunes of the village were shaped by those in charge of its famous castle, from early English kings to 18th-century philanthropists, who pioneered a welfare system nearly 200 years before one existed nationally. Ben visits fellow archaeologist Jessica Turner, whose findings show the seventh-century residents of Bamburgh were robust and healthy - contrary to the usual malnourishment of the British medieval population
S02E01

programme.title: Chariots of Fire (1981)
programme.desc: Oscar-winning drama based on the true story of British runners Eric Liddell and Harold Abrahams, going for gold at the 1924 Olympics in Paris. The two athletes are driven by very different impulses - Liddell is inspired by his devout Christian faith, while Abrahams hopes to triumph over the anti-Semitism he has endured all his life. Starring Ian Charleson, Ben Cross, Nigel Havers, John Gielgud and Ian Holm. Vangelis provides the soundtrack

programme.title: Rain Man (1988)
programme.desc: Brash yuppie car dealer Charlie discovers his deceased father has left the family fortune to Raymond, the autistic elder brother he never knew he had. In a bid to get his hands on the money, he tracks down and abducts Raymond - but the ensuing cross-country journey proves to be a profound learning experience for them both. Oscar-winning drama, starring Tom Cruise and Dustin Hoffman, with Valeria Golino, Gerald R Molen and Jack Murdock

programme.title: Hans Zimmer: Hollywood Rebel
programme.desc: Profile of the Oscar-winning composer responsible for some of the best-loved film and TV scores of the past few decades. Contributors include directors Christopher Nolan, Denis Villeneuve, and Steve McQueen. In this portrait, Zimmer reveals the musical secrets of his craft - how he goes about terrifying, moving and raising people's spirits through his work

programme.title: Peaky Blinders
programme.desc:
The Road to Hell: Tommy sets out to change the face of Birmingham's Chinatown, and seeks to use donations to the church to guarantee a path of reconciliation for his brother Arthur. Back in the Garrison Tavern, he makes an introduction that promises to change his family forever, and on a barge in Solihull, he has an encounter that could jeopardise his own marriage
S06E05

programme.title: Peaky Blinders
programme.desc:
Lock and Key: 1933 brings both opportunities and dangers to the Peaky Blinders. As the clouds of the coming storm gather, Tommy is beset by demons old and new, and must face the consequences of his experiences and his actions to deal with a world on the road to war. Final episode of the period gangster drama, starring Cillian Murphy, with Tom Hardy reprising his role from the show's second series
S06E06

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 14/04/1994: Meat Loaf presents and performs on the chart show from April 14, 1994, also featuring Terrorvision, Reel 2 Real with the Mad Stuntman, Pet Shop Boys, Frances Ruffelle, Loveland vs Darlene Lewis, Garth Brooks, Toni Braxton and Take That

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 21/04/1994: Mark Goodier presents the chart show from April 21, 1994, featuring Crash Test Dummies, Bitty McLean, CJ Lewis, the Pretenders, Erasure, Crystal Waters, Deacon Blue, Toni Di Bart and Prince

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 02/03/1978: Noel Edmonds presents an edition from March 2, 1978, featuring performances by Darts, Kate Bush, Nick Lowe, Andy Williams, Samantha Sang, Rita Coolidge, the Tom Robinson Band and Abba

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 03/03/1983: John Peel and David Jensen present an edition from March 3, featuring OMD, Bananarama, Michael Jackson, and Patti Austin and James Ingram

programme.title: St David's Day at the BBC
programme.desc: A rummage through the BBC's music archives, featuring a selection of tracks from some of the most important and innovative Welsh artists of the past few decades. The programme includes performances by Manic Street Preachers, Catatonia, Super Furry Animals, Marina and the Diamonds, Stereophonics, Feeder, Shakin' Stevens, Bonnie Tyler, Shirley Bassey and Tom Jones

programme.title: Manics Back to Blackwood
programme.desc: Manic Street Preachers return to perform in their home town of Blackwood for the first time in more than 25 years. The intimate gig at the Miners' Institute features versions of hits spanning three decades, behind-the-scenes footage and an interview with the band

programme.title: Wales: Music Nation with Huw Stephens
programme.desc: The first of two programmes in which Huw delves deep into the surprising and varied story of music in Wales by putting together a unique Welsh mixtape. Jumping from choirs to pop groups, Tom Jones to the triple harp, haunting medieval music to urban rap, Huw explores what makes Welsh music unique, and the qualities it shares right across the centuries. Contributors include Tom Jones, Manic Street Preachers and Dafydd Iwan

programme.title: Wales: Music Nation with Huw Stephens
programme.desc: In the second of two programmes, Huw takes a trip to the south Wales valleys to meet the world-famous Treorchy male voice choir, and to dig into the story of how another choir helped Wales become known as the Land of Song. At the other end of the country, Huw meets singer-songwriter Dafydd Iwan, whose song Yma o Hyd has recently become a football anthem

programme.title: St David's Day at the BBC
programme.desc: A rummage through the BBC's music archives, featuring a selection of tracks from some of the most important and innovative Welsh artists of the past few decades. The programme includes performances by Manic Street Preachers, Catatonia, Super Furry Animals, Marina and the Diamonds, Stereophonics, Feeder, Shakin' Stevens, Bonnie Tyler, Shirley Bassey and Tom Jones

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 14/04/1994: Meat Loaf presents and performs on the chart show from April 14, 1994, also featuring Terrorvision, Reel 2 Real with the Mad Stuntman, Pet Shop Boys, Frances Ruffelle, Loveland vs Darlene Lewis, Garth Brooks, Toni Braxton and Take That

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 21/04/1994: Mark Goodier presents the chart show from April 21, 1994, featuring Crash Test Dummies, Bitty McLean, CJ Lewis, the Pretenders, Erasure, Crystal Waters, Deacon Blue, Toni Di Bart and Prince

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 02/03/1978: Noel Edmonds presents an edition from March 2, 1978, featuring performances by Darts, Kate Bush, Nick Lowe, Andy Williams, Samantha Sang, Rita Coolidge, the Tom Robinson Band and Abba

programme.title: Brazil with Michael Palin
programme.desc:
Out of Africa: The seasoned traveller explores the South American country, beginning in the north-east - where Europeans first landed and grew rich on the profits from sugar and tobacco plantations run with slave labour. In Sao Luis, Michael finds out about a ceremony based on a 200-year-old tale before heading to the coastal lagoons of the Lencois Maranhenses National Park. Journeying inland, he gets a glimpse of the fast-disappearing world of old-style cowboys known as vaqueiros, has his fortune read by a Candomble priest and learns to drum with the Olodum cultural collective
S01E01

programme.title: Brazil with Michael Palin
programme.desc:
Into Amazonia: The Monty Python star continues his first visit to Brazil by travelling by river from the northern border with Venezuela to the capital of Brasilia. Along the way he visits indigenous tribe the Yanomami, learning about the threat to their hunter-gatherer way of life, before watching a rehearsal by the Amazon Philharmonic Orchestra and searching for the remains of Henry Ford's unsuccessful attempt to build a vast rubber plantation in the middle of the rainforest. In Belem, music producer Priscilla explains why Amazonian women are such powerful forces, then he moves southwards, meeting rock star and political activist Dinho Ouro Preto, who believes that despite its social and environmental problems, the country is on the brink of becoming a superpower
S01E02

programme.title: Paris Police 1905
programme.desc:
The Paris vice squad begins to clean prostitutes off the city's streets, only to discover a man's body in the public park. Inspector Antoine Jouin heads up the investigation. In French
S01E01

programme.title: Paris Police 1905
programme.desc:
Lepine asks Jouin to remain discreet in his report of a death to avoid a scandal. Marguerite Steinheil prepares for the opening of a new collection of her husband's work, to which she has invited Lepine. In French
S01E02

programme.title: A Bit of Fry and Laurie
programme.desc:
An angry audience member claims ownership of the episode's sketches. A teenage poet helps a headmaster to express himself and a drug dealer applies for a bank loan
S01E04

programme.title: A Bit of Fry and Laurie
programme.desc:
A lawyer cross-examines a witness, an actor reminisces about the people he's worked with over the years, and a couple at a christening can't decide what to name their child. Irreverent comedy with Stephen Fry and Hugh Laurie
S01E05

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc:
The Copper Kettle: Lionel and Jean spend a nostalgic day in Buckinghamshire reliving their courtship days - but find things have changed in the intervening years. However, certain treasured memories remain. Originally shown in 1992
S01E03

programme.title: Brazil with Michael Palin
programme.desc:
Out of Africa: The seasoned traveller explores the South American country, beginning in the north-east - where Europeans first landed and grew rich on the profits from sugar and tobacco plantations run with slave labour. In Sao Luis, Michael finds out about a ceremony based on a 200-year-old tale before heading to the coastal lagoons of the Lencois Maranhenses National Park. Journeying inland, he gets a glimpse of the fast-disappearing world of old-style cowboys known as vaqueiros, has his fortune read by a Candomble priest and learns to drum with the Olodum cultural collective
S01E01

programme.title: Brazil with Michael Palin
programme.desc:
Into Amazonia: The Monty Python star continues his first visit to Brazil by travelling by river from the northern border with Venezuela to the capital of Brasilia. Along the way he visits indigenous tribe the Yanomami, learning about the threat to their hunter-gatherer way of life, before watching a rehearsal by the Amazon Philharmonic Orchestra and searching for the remains of Henry Ford's unsuccessful attempt to build a vast rubber plantation in the middle of the rainforest. In Belem, music producer Priscilla explains why Amazonian women are such powerful forces, then he moves southwards, meeting rock star and political activist Dinho Ouro Preto, who believes that despite its social and environmental problems, the country is on the brink of becoming a superpower
S01E02

programme.title: The Story of Welsh Art
programme.desc:
Huw Stephens reveals how, as the 20th century dawned, artists found radical new ways to depict Wales, pushing themselves to extremes and redefining what art could be. His venture takes him to the National Museum Wales in Cardiff, Bardsey Island off the Llyn Peninsula, Colwyn Bay and Swansea
S01E03

programme.title: Come Dancing
programme.desc:
Terry Wogan introduces another edition of the inter-regional dance contest from 1977, which sees Midlands and West compete against Home Counties North at the Locarno Ballroom, Bradford. Barri Haynes provides the commentary
S1977E02

programme.title: Revisor by Crystal Pite and Jonathon Young
programme.desc: A performance of the critically acclaimed dance-theatre production, created by award-winning choreographer Crystal Pite and playwright Jonathon Young, recorded at Sadler's Wells in March. Revisor is based on the well-known play The Government Inspector by Nikolai Gogol, and Young and Pite revised the archetypal comic plot to serve as the basis for a production that blends contemporary theatre and dance

programme.title: Listening Through the Lens: The Christopher Nupen Films
programme.desc: Documentary about the director who championed classical music on TV, seizing upon his unique access to a generation of musicians. Narrated by Stephen Fry

programme.title: We Want the Light: Jews and German Music
programme.desc: Documentary examining the complex relationship between Jews and German music, from Mendelssohn to Wagner, and the role of music in the German concentration camps

programme.title: Clive James: Postcard from Rio
programme.desc: Clive visits the Brazilian city of Rio de Janeiro, where the poor live by their wits in the favelas while the wealthy make contact with their less fortunate neighbours only when a servant is paid or a millionaire is mugged

programme.title: Victorian Sensations
programme.desc:
Decadence and Degeneration: Actor Paul McGann explores the 1890s, a decade when science, entertainment, art and morality collided. He discovers how the works of HG Wells, Aubrey Beardsley and Oscar Wilde were shaped by fears of moral, social and racial degeneration, and explains how Wilde sought to subvert traditional Victorian values
S01E02

programme.title: Patagonia with Huw Edwards
programme.desc: The newsreader follows in the footsteps of settlers who travelled from Wales to Patagonia 150 years ago with the intention of creating a colony where their language and culture would endure. On arrival in South America, Huw meets descendants of the original immigrants and examines how much of their spirit lives on in the present

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.desc:
Bridging the Gap: How the Severn Bridge Was Built: Liz Bonnin marks the 50th anniversary of the construction of the Severn Bridge in a Timeshift special telling the inside story of its design and construction. As the motorway link between England and Wales, the Severn Bridge was described as 'the most perfect suspension bridge in the world', and Liz reveals how its unique, slim-line structure came about by accident
S16E01

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Newcastle to Co Durham: Michael Portillo explores the Britain of the 1930s as he sets out on another adventure. Beginning just outside Newcastle in Jarrow, Michael uncovers the desperation that led 200 men to march 300 miles to Westminster in order to petition the government for work. The first leg of his journey ends Spennymoor, Co Durham, where he meets the son of a miner who became one of the most famous 20th-century artists of the region
S11E01

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc:
Thorpeness - Suffolk: Archaeologist Ben Robinson uncovers the secrets of Thorpeness in Suffolk, the first purpose-built seaside village in the UK. The ingenuity of amenities such as the hand-dug lake, country club and inland housing were the unique vision of Glencairn Stuart Ogilvie. Hamish Ogilvie helps Ben to understand his great-grandfather's vision, stemming from theatrical inspiration
S02E03

programme.title: Archaeology: A Secret History
programme.desc:
In the Beginning: Richard Miles charts the history of archaeological breakthroughs in a mission to understand the ancient past. In the first programme, he explores how the profession began by trying to prove a biblical truth
S01E01

programme.title: Art of France
programme.desc:
There Will Be Blood: Andrew Graham-Dixon explores how art in France took a dramatic turn after the Revolution ushered in a bold new world of artists including Jacques-Louis David and Theodore Gericault
S01E02

programme.title: Bent Coppers: Crossing the Line of Duty
programme.desc:
Exploring the sleazy underbelly of London's Soho in the early 1970s, where an explosion of dirty pornographic bookshops provides an open invitation for corrupt police to be greedy. With insider interviewers and archive footage, this episode continues to unearth the lawless underworld of 1970s London, audacious levels of police corruption and the birth of the internal force tasked with combating it
S01E02

programme.title: Big Sky, Big Dreams, Big Art: Made in the USA
programme.desc:
Waldemar Januszczak focuses on the America of small towns and trailer parks, discovering how these much-maligned territories had an immensely beneficial impact on American art. From the small-town brilliance of Grant Wood, to the small-town alienation of Edward Hopper, to the spooky Dust Bowl symbolism of Alexandre Hogue, interstitial America inspired much that was great. The film culminates in the assemblages of David Smith, the leading sculptor of Abstract Expressionism
S01E03

programme.title: Romancing the Stone: The Golden Ages of British Sculpture
programme.desc:
Children of the Revolution: Alastair Sooke examines sculpture in the 20th century, an era of innovation, scandal and creativity. He examines the artistic revolution spearheaded by Eric Gill and Jacob Epstein, which paved the way for the work of Gilbert & George and Damien Hirst. He also explores the art form's rise in popularity, from First World War memorials to the landmark work of Antony Gormley and Rachel Whiteread
S01E03

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Newcastle to Co Durham: Michael Portillo explores the Britain of the 1930s as he sets out on another adventure. Beginning just outside Newcastle in Jarrow, Michael uncovers the desperation that led 200 men to march 300 miles to Westminster in order to petition the government for work. The first leg of his journey ends Spennymoor, Co Durham, where he meets the son of a miner who became one of the most famous 20th-century artists of the region
S11E01

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc:
Thorpeness - Suffolk: Archaeologist Ben Robinson uncovers the secrets of Thorpeness in Suffolk, the first purpose-built seaside village in the UK. The ingenuity of amenities such as the hand-dug lake, country club and inland housing were the unique vision of Glencairn Stuart Ogilvie. Hamish Ogilvie helps Ben to understand his great-grandfather's vision, stemming from theatrical inspiration
S02E03

programme.title: Archaeology: A Secret History
programme.desc:
In the Beginning: Richard Miles charts the history of archaeological breakthroughs in a mission to understand the ancient past. In the first programme, he explores how the profession began by trying to prove a biblical truth
S01E01

programme.title: Art of France
programme.desc:
There Will Be Blood: Andrew Graham-Dixon explores how art in France took a dramatic turn after the Revolution ushered in a bold new world of artists including Jacques-Louis David and Theodore Gericault
S01E02

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Devon 1/5: The first of a week of dinner parties in Devon is hosted by community nurse Tina, who hopes to impress her guests with a menu incorporating all of her favourite dishes

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Devon 2/5: In Devon, Essex native Rob is pinning his hopes on an Italian-themed menu - and some artful entertainment - to land him the 1,000 prize money

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Devon 3/5: Pilot Rhys hosts the latest dinner party in Devon, but one of the guests is thrown out of an imaginary lifeboat and an interesting find leads to Rhys being mistaken for a stripper

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Devon 4/5: HR manager Holly serves up restaurant favourites in Devon, but her guests are put out when she sets rules over the use of the toilet - and a portrait leaves the men open-mouthed

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Devon 5/5: In Devon, detective Steve is counting on a menu of bold and experimental flavours to win him the 1,000 prize. His feast of bold flavours goes down a storm with most of the guests, but also sparks a Pavlova row between Tina and Holly

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2016: Charente: A couple from Portsmouth have decided to buy a second home in Charente. With a budget of 45,000, Scarlette Douglas help them look for a bargain property

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2022: Benalmdena: Laura Hamilton meets Gill and Paul, a couple from Derbyshire who are searching for a holiday home in Benalmdena on Spain's Costa del Sol, on a 110,000 budget. It has been Gill's dream for at least 30 years to have a place that she can escape to during the cold, winter months

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc:
A return visit to James and Annie's craft brewery in Portugal to see whether they have they successfully managed to crack the local market. Plus, cameras head back to Kevin and Lisa's kite surfing school in southern Spain to see if they're still flying high
S05E05

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Stroud 1/5: The competition begins in Stroud with horse trainer Melanie, who has opted for a quick and easy vegetarian menu so she can focus on a glamorous night of hosting - and partying

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Stroud 2/5: Elliot hosts the second dinner party in Stroud and after making a good impression on radio presenter Kate, his guests are expecting big things. Tensions rise between Kate and fellow horse owner Mel as to who owns the most livestock leaving Belarusian rock fan Tasty and events manager Liv bored

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Stroud 3/5: Belarusian rocker Tasty hosts the third night in Stroud and presents a taste of 'Mother Russia' inspired by her culture and heritage. Kate and Mel squabble yet again as they come up with roles for their newly formed band, Elliot's Angels, much to Liv's disapproval. With some Russian dancing and pretend figure skating it's an interesting night but will Tasty do enough to impress her guests

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Stroud 4/5: On the fourth evening in Stroud, Gloucestershire, marketing executive Liz incorporates her love of Italian food into her menu, hoping to impress her guests with large arancini balls, homemade ravioli and a rather lumpy panna cotta. Elliot feels his place at the top of the leaderboard is under threat, however Tatsy finds the constant chat about horses from Mel and Kate increasingly annoying

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Stroud 5/5: On the final evening in Stroud, Gloucestershire, it's a battle of the risottos as radio presenter Kate produces one very similar to that made earlier by arch-rival Mel. However, Kate has a secret weapon in the shape of a magical table decoration that may help her clinch the 1,000 prize

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2022: Costa del Sol: Laura Hamilton helps a Cardiff couple with two teenage children to find a holiday home around Mijas on Spain's Costa del Sol, on a budget of 200,000

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc:
Two motorcyclists need specialist care, as the helicopter medics try to save the life of Pete, while Tom may have a serious spinal injury. Plus, a woman is kicked in the face by her horse. Documentary following the work of air ambulance crews
S01E01

programme.title: Sarah Beeny's New Life in the Country
programme.desc:
Sarah and Graham set about transforming the kitchen from bare shell to the heart of their family home. But from the outset, they have differing views - will they be able to come up with something they'll both enjoy spending time in? Away from the build, keen angler Graham learns how to smoke his home-caught fish, he and Sarah invite a group of metal detectorists to the farm to check out the variety of treasures they have unearthed, and the family band rehearse for their first gig at the local pub
S02E08

programme.title: Matt Baker: Our Farm in the Dales
programme.desc:
In summer, the sheep are sheared and Matt makes plans for a new home for the chickens that will give them access to free-range grazing. The family attempts the first honey harvest. It is movie night in the courtyard as the footage captured by the wildlife cameras in the woodlands is finally revealed. With the body of the Dodge lifted off its chassis, the engine at its heart has been revealed
S02E05

programme.title: The Great Pottery Throw Down
programme.desc:
It's the quarter-final, and the remaining five potters face an altered reality as they throw and radically alter an abstract coffee set. The bucket of doom returns as judges Keith and Rich set a second challenge to throw multiple high-footed rice bowls under pressure, but who will secure an all-important place in the semi-final?
S2023E08

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc:
The armchair critics are back to tuck into their takeaways while sharing their thoughts on the best of week's TV and streaming output. Shows include Starstruck, The Piano, You, Rick Stein's Cornwall, Stacey Dooley Sleeps Over USA, 24 Hours in A&E, a This Morning feature about the world's longest tongue and ITV News reporting on cheese
S21E01

programme.title: Bronson: Fit to Be Free?
programme.desc:
Charles Bronson is the UK's most notorious prisoner. After serving 48 years in prison, he is due to make his case for release at a parole board hearing held in public - one of the first of its kind. This two-part special gives voice to some of his victims, those closest to Bronson, and various members of the criminal justice system to ascertain whether he is fit to be released
S01E01

programme.title: Guy Martin's Great British Power Trip
programme.desc:
Guy investigates the future of energy production, travelling to Orkney to look at how the Scottish islands are at the forefront of hydrogen research. He also joins the workforce at Europe's biggest building site and the Hinkley Point C nuclear power station, finding out why reactors are so expensive and take 10 years to build, and works inside Britain's most toxic site - handling nuclear waste inside the Sellafield facility
S01E03

programme.title: Sex Actually with Alice Levine
programme.desc:
Alice Levine continues to explore the sex lives of others, discovering out-of-the-ordinary love stories from across the world. In this first episode, she dives into new, advanced technologies that could be what sex and relationships will look like in the future, meeting a couple in Berlin who opened the world's first cyber-brothel, populated by talking sex dolls. She heads to Las Vegas to witness the next generation of sex-robots and also meets a couple whose relationship exists in a virtual 'furry' universe, but who are about to risk it all, taking their love affair offline and moving across the world to be together IRL (In Real Life)
S02E01

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel Fitzpatrick steps out of his comfort zone by heading to South Africa to spend time with the magnificent animals of the savannah and the selfless people who dedicate their lives to looking after them - often in very difficult circumstances. Noel meets the animals threatened by poaching, injured due to neglect in captivity, and exploited in one way or another. The pioneering vet also helps endangered rhinos and improve the lives of two big cats by performing procedures rarely - if ever - provided for wild animals before

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc:
Documentary following the staff of Woodgreen animal charity, who are committed to matching their homeless dogs with prospective owners. programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc:
Huddersfield & Calderdale: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help house-hunters find their dream properties in the Peak District, guiding them through the complex world of viewings and agents. Kirstie is with single mother Anne, who sold her home in Sheffield to move to the countryside with her teenage son. However, a short-term stay with her parents has turned into eight months, so Kirstie has her work cut out to find Anne a suitable property fast. Phil is with Andrea and James, who are still searching for their ideal place after two years
S27E04

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc:
A 50-year-old woman is rushed to A&E having collapsed at work following a thunderclap headache, leaving doctors concerned that she may have a bleed on her brain. Her husband shares the story of how they met and the challenges they have had to overcome. Other patients include a 13-year-old boy hit by a car while riding his bike and a woman concerned by a headache, who describes her childhood spent in Zambia and Lancashire
S28E01

programme.title: Sex Actually with Alice Levine
programme.desc:
Alice Levine continues to explore the sex lives of others, discovering out-of-the-ordinary love stories from across the world. In this first episode, she dives into new, advanced technologies that could be what sex and relationships will look like in the future, meeting a couple in Berlin who opened the world's first cyber-brothel, populated by talking sex dolls. She heads to Las Vegas to witness the next generation of sex-robots and also meets a couple whose relationship exists in a virtual 'furry' universe, but who are about to risk it all, taking their love affair offline and moving across the world to be together IRL (In Real Life)
S02E01

programme.title: Bronson: Fit to Be Free?
programme.desc:
Giving a voice to some of Bronson's victims, those closest to him and members of the criminal justice system and asking if he is fit for release
S01E02

programme.title: Katie Price's Mucky Mansion
programme.desc:
Katie transforms her daughter Bunny's bedroom into a mermaid themed paradise. She also creates a Hollywood-inspired cinema room and when the online threats get worse the former model is pushed to improve her home security. Renovations come crashing to a halt when an old injury rears its head
S02E02

programme.title: Send Nudes: Body SOS
programme.desc:
Using ground-breaking technology, individuals considering cosmetic surgery get to see themselves like they have never seen before through full-size avatars of their naked bodies. In the opening episode, Vogue Williams meets chiselled carpenter Steven, who wants a porn star-sized penis, and single mum Steph, who is desperate for smaller boobs. But as they both confront their life-size naked avatars, will they decide to push ahead with their plans for surgery or will their minds be changed by what they see in front of them?
S01E01

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc:
West Cumbria, 2010: Kevin McCloud follows former blacksmith Alan Dawson, who has devised a way of building that should allow him to complete his home in just seven days. The method resembles that of a giant toy construction, with wiring, lighting, plumbing and carpets built into sections that are then taken to the site by lorry - but precision is critical if the house is to fit together
S10E07

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc:
George meets a man who plans to turn the front half of a plane into the ultimate crash pad, complete with loads of 'toys'. To celebrate the 10th anniversary of the show, George tracks down a former contributor from the first-ever series, to find out how Amazing Spaces has changed his - and George's - life. While in Israel, George drives into the desert to track down a small but breathtaking natural build and, after finding a name for his caravan and moving it 250 miles from its build site in Bedford to its final home in the Lakes, George's own 10th anniversary build is finally finished, and he can reveal his unique Arts and Crafts caravan
S11E08

programme.title: Devon and Cornwall
programme.desc: In the fold of the foothills of Exmoor, Devon farmers Rob and Sarah Taylor prepare their native ponies for the show season, but first they need to round them up from off the moor. At the southern tip of Cornwall, the South West Coastal Path is under threat of erosion from the thousands of footsteps veering off the marked track each year

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Harrogate 1/5: Five cooks from in and around Harrogate, North Yorkshire, battle to win the 1,000 prize in the culinary contest. First to take on hosting duties is farm girl Jane Steele, who hopes a combination of innovative recipes and fancy wine will win over her guests - horse enthusiast Cassy Bell, photographer Simon Meyer, country gent Alasdair Moore and adventurous punk and cupcake seller Cathy McConaghy

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Harrogate 2/5: Horse enthusiast Cassy Bell hosts the second dinner party in Harrogate, North Yorkshire, hoping her jockey-themed evening and gastro-pub menu will be enough to win her the 1,000 prize

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Harrogate 3/5: Cathy McConaghy hosts the third dinner party in Harrogate, North Yorkshire, where she decides to return to her Irish roots and serve a menu of home-made soda bread, cockle soup, oysters, roast lamb, and stout-infused sticky toffee pudding as she vies for the 1,000 prize. However, not all of her guests are impressed with the choice of food being dished up

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Harrogate 4/5: Photographer Simon Meyer is the fourth dinner-party host in Harrogate, North Yorkshire. He takes a laid-back approach to the task, but his chicken soup starter goes down so well the guests' comments leave him struggling to retain his composure

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Harrogate 5/5: Country gent Alasdair Moore hosts the final dinner party in Harrogate, and hopes to impress his guests with his specially selected wines and 'proper' menu. While his monkfish is well received, an early slip-up dents his confidence, and a risky parlour game does not endear him to farm lady Jane Steele. As the evening progresses, his competitors rate their experience, before the winner of the 1,000 cash prize is announced

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2015: Cinque Terre, Italy: Single mother-of-four Helen Broomhead from Cheshire is longing for a place in the picturesque Cinque Terre region of Italy. Jasmine Harman shows Helen and her best friend Charlotte five potentially perfect boltholes

programme.desc: 2020: Larnaca, Cyprus: Childhood sweethearts Sue and Andy are looking for a holiday home on the Mediterranean island of Cyprus, so Danni Menzies lines up five properties close to the city of Larnaca

programme.title: The Great Pottery Throw Down
programme.desc:
It's the quarter-final, and the remaining five potters face an altered reality as they throw and radically alter an abstract coffee set. The bucket of doom returns as judges Keith and Rich set a second challenge to throw multiple high-footed rice bowls under pressure, but who will secure an all-important place in the semi-final?
S2023E08

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc:
Cambridgeshire 2021: Kevin McCloud meets widowed teacher Gretta, who is making a fresh start in rural Cambridgeshire with a Malaysian-inspired burnt wood and glass home being designed by her nephew Carlos and project managed by her brother-in-law Fernando - despite his lack of building experience. However, as site clearance begins, so does the Covid-19 pandemic - and family harmony is tested when an apple tree much loved by Fernando is condemned for removal by Gretta
S21E04

programme.title: Bronson: Fit to Be Free?
programme.desc:
Charles Bronson is the UK's most notorious prisoner. After serving 48 years in prison, he is due to make his case for release at a parole board hearing held in public - one of the first of its kind. This two-part special gives voice to some of his victims, those closest to Bronson, and various members of the criminal justice system to ascertain whether he is fit to be released
S01E01

programme.title: Bronson: Fit to Be Free?
programme.desc:
Giving a voice to some of Bronson's victims, those closest to him and members of the criminal justice system and asking if he is fit for release

programme.desc:

Friends and insiders lift the lid on how Mark Zuckerberg runs his online empire
S01E03

programme.title: The Piano
programme.desc:
The hunt for outstanding amateur pianists continues in Glasgow Central Station with impromptu performances from a local jazz legend, an 86 year-old father of 11, a YouTube star and a boogie woogie biker who believes music is in her DNA. programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Devon 4/5: HR manager Holly serves up restaurant favourites in Devon, but her guests are put out when she sets rules over the use of the toilet - and a portrait leaves the men open-mouthed

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Devon 5/5: In Devon, detective Steve is counting on a menu of bold and experimental flavours to win him the 1,000 prize. His feast of bold flavours goes down a storm with most of the guests, but also sparks a Pavlova row between Tina and Holly

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2022: Orihuela Costa, Spain: Leah Charles-King is in Spain's Orihuela Costa to help Donna and Graeme find their perfect holiday home. They're after a light and airy two or three-bedroom apartment. Leah seeks out five impressive properties for the couple's budget of 75,000

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc:
In Sunderland, medics must work quickly to try and save a woman's life following a major gas explosion. A boating accident on the Norfolk Broads leaves holidaymaker Carol with a partially amputated foot. Plus, a man suffers multiple serious injuries when he comes off his motorbike
S01E04

programme.title: World's Most Secret Hotels
programme.desc:
Hilltop Escapes: Including a trip to the Scottish wilderness in search of spaceships and a visit to the Welsh mountains to probe some mysterious looking spheres. Plus, a tower in Greece with a deadly history and a hotel perched on a glacier in Italy
S01E05

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It: Brilliant Builds
programme.desc:
Kirstie and Phil's Love it or List it: Brilliant Builds: Kirstie and Phil look back on some of their most interesting renovations and house-hunts, starting with Sophie and Paul in Aylesbury, who were divided over their three-bed house which Paul bought himself. After meeting Sophie and having two children together, Paul decided he wanted to move into a bigger and better family home while Sophie wanted to stay in the area with her family nearby. Amy and Louis in Cowbridge, Wales were in turmoil over their period home which Louis had inherited from his late grandmother. The house held many memories for Louis but with his recent diagnosis and the upkeep required, Amy doubted it could be a long-term home for them
S04E01

programme.title: Guy Martin's Great British Power Trip
programme.desc:
Guy investigates the future of energy production, travelling to Orkney to look at how the Scottish islands are at the forefront of hydrogen research. He also joins the workforce at Europe's biggest building site and the Hinkley Point C nuclear power station, finding out why reactors are so expensive and take 10 years to build, and works inside Britain's most toxic site - handling nuclear waste inside the Sellafield facility
S01E03

programme.title: Hancock (2008)
programme.desc: A reluctant, alcoholic superhero ends up the most hated man in Los Angeles thanks to his habit of causing mayhem and destruction while trying to do good. Comedy, starring Will Smith, Jason Bateman and Charlize Theron

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc:
George meets a man who plans to turn the front half of a plane into the ultimate crash pad, complete with loads of 'toys'. To celebrate the 10th anniversary of the show, George tracks down a former contributor from the first-ever series, to find out how Amazing Spaces has changed his - and George's - life. While in Israel, George drives into the desert to track down a small but breathtaking natural build and, after finding a name for his caravan and moving it 250 miles from its build site in Bedford to its final home in the Lakes, George's own 10th anniversary build is finally finished, and he can reveal his unique Arts and Crafts caravan
S11E08

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc:
Woodgreen animal charity staff set about matching their homeless dogs with more prospective owners. Eighty-five-year-old Pim thinks Dexter the beagle is as stubborn as Elizabeth, his wife of 62 years. It's possible that shy Jack Russell Roxy could prove a better match. Chihuahuas Bear and Dave try to convince seven-year-old husky-fan Ollie that two little dogs are better than one
S03E03

programme.title: Military Wives (2019)
programme.desc: With their partners away serving in Afghanistan, a group of women on the home front form a choir and quickly find themselves at the centre of a media sensation and global movement. As unexpected bonds of friendship flourish, music and laughter transform their lives, helping them to overcome their fears for their loved ones in combat. Comedy drama, starring Kristin Scott Thomas, Sharon Horgan and Emma Lowndes

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.desc:

Meanwhile, Phil Spencer goes property searching with downsizing duo Kerrie and Dave, who sold their beloved barn conversion to move closer to their kids

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc:

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2022: Costa del Sol: Laura Hamilton helps a Cardiff couple with two teenage children to find a holiday home around Mijas on Spain's Costa del Sol, on a budget of 200,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It: Brilliant Builds
programme.desc:
Kirstie and Phil look back on some of their most interesting renovations and house-hunts, starting with Sophie and Paul in Aylesbury, who were divided over their three-bed house which Paul bought himself. After meeting Sophie and having two children together, Paul decided he wanted to move into a bigger and better family home while Sophie wanted to stay in the area with her family nearby. Amy and Louis in Cowbridge, Wales were in turmoil over their period home which Louis had inherited from his late grandmother. The house held many memories for Louis but with his recent diagnosis and the upkeep required, Amy doubted it could be a long-term home for them
S04E01

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc:
Billingshurst, Sussex 2021: Kevin McCloud meets master carpenter Olaf, who is facing the biggest challenge of his career - creating an oasis for himself and partner Fritha on a small slice of land in West Sussex, which happens to be surrounded by a mainline railway and a busy A-road. Not only that, but half of the plot can't even be built on due an underground mains sewer. All they're left with is a very small triangle on which to build their future life together. With 190,000 in the bank, Olaf and Fritha must use all the ingenuity they can muster to make their triangular three-bedroom house come to life
S21E02

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc:
A 56-year-old woman is rushed to St George's with an open ankle fracture after falling in her garden, and a man suffering chest pains looks back on his career on the railway, which was cut short by a leg amputation. An 84-year-old man collapses at home following a bout of dizziness, and his children reflect on the challenges of watching his health decline in recent years
S24E06

programme.title: Sex Actually with Alice Levine
programme.desc:
Alice Levine continues to explore the sex lives of others, discovering out-of-the-ordinary love stories from across the world. In this first episode, she dives into new, advanced technologies that could be what sex and relationships will look like in the future, meeting a couple in Berlin who opened the world's first cyber-brothel, populated by talking sex dolls. She heads to Las Vegas to witness the next generation of sex-robots and also meets a couple whose relationship exists in a virtual 'furry' universe, but who are about to risk it all, taking their love affair offline and moving across the world to be together IRL (In Real Life)
S02E01

programme.title: Send Nudes: Body SOS
programme.desc:
Using ground-breaking technology, individuals considering cosmetic surgery get to see themselves like they have never seen before through full-size avatars of their naked bodies. In the opening episode, Vogue Williams meets chiselled carpenter Steven, who wants a porn star-sized penis, and single mum Steph, who is desperate for smaller boobs. But as they both confront their life-size naked avatars, will they decide to push ahead with their plans for surgery or will their minds be changed by what they see in front of them?
S01E01

programme.title: Guy Martin's Great British Power Trip
programme.desc:
Guy investigates the future of energy production, travelling to Orkney to look at how the Scottish islands are at the forefront of hydrogen research. He also joins the workforce at Europe's biggest building site and the Hinkley Point C nuclear power station, finding out why reactors are so expensive and take 10 years to build, and works inside Britain's most toxic site - handling nuclear waste inside the Sellafield facility
S01E03

programme.title: Devon and Cornwall
programme.desc: In the fold of the foothills of Exmoor, Devon farmers Rob and Sarah Taylor prepare their native ponies for the show season, but first they need to round them up from off the moor. At the southern tip of Cornwall, the South West Coastal Path is under threat of erosion from the thousands of footsteps veering off the marked track each year

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun: Where Are They Now?

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.desc:
Part one of two. How the singer's outing was a landmark moment in gay politics, with a potential career-ending scandal being averted by seizing control of the media narrative. Watching them all in secret are Lang Lang and Mika, who are looking for a performer to play at The Royal Festival Hall
S01E03

programme.title: Song for Marion (2012)
programme.desc: A grouchy old man has always been dismissive of his wife's role in the unconventional local choir. When she is diagnosed with a terminal illness and is no longer able to sing, he reluctantly agrees to take her place, a decision that dramatically changes his life and helps him through the hard times to come. Comedy drama, with Terence Stamp, Gemma Arterton, Vanessa Redgrave and Christopher Eccleston

programme.title: The Last Station (2009)
programme.desc: A naive young man is appointed as the private secretary to the ageing Leo Tolstoy in 1910, but finds himself in the middle of a bitter conflict. The writer has embraced strong socialist and pacifist principles and wishes to leave everything to the people - but his wife does not want to give up his legacy. Period drama, with James McAvoy, Christopher Plummer and Helen Mirren

programme.title: The Others (2001)
programme.desc: A woman awaits the return of her husband from the Second World War while struggling to care for her son and daughter. Both children suffer a violent reaction when exposed to daylight, forcing her to keep much of their isolated home on the island of Jersey shrouded in gloom. When the pair claim to see strangers in the house, their terrified mother begins to suspect that the souls of the dead are stalking the halls. Period supernatural thriller, starring Nicole Kidman, Fionnula Flanagan, Alakina Mann, James Bentley and Christopher Eccleston

programme.desc: A struggling artist pursues his dreams at the expense of his family's lives. programme.title: The Wrestler (2008)
programme.desc: An ageing wrestler who was a big star in the 1980s is now long past his prime. programme.desc: A composer takes in a penniless writer, but when he realises his kindness is being cruelly exploited, he kills his guest in a fit of rage.
